title: Maximal Coverage Location-Allocation Using Geospatial Data
text: Assessing planning infrastructure service networks, given dispersed demand, limited capacity, accessibility targets, concerns spatial justice, central policy challenge. Problems type commonly referred Maximal Coverage Location-Allocation (MCLA) spatial optimization problems. locationallocation R package provides tools solving MCLA problems geospatial data. builds widely used spatial libraries R, follows tidyverse principles, integrates seamlessly broader tidyverse ecosystem. package can generate travel-time maps optimize placement facilities infrastructure according accessibility criteria, can weighted one variables user-defined function. Potential applications package extend domains public infrastructure assessment planning (public services provision, e.g. transport, social services, healthcare, parks), urban environmental climate risk reduction interventions, logistics hubs allocation, commercial strategic decisions. find project useful, please consider giving star!

title: Maximal Coverage Location-Allocation Using Geospatial Data
text: use package, start loading R session using library function: example, demonstrate package can address urban-scale climate risk infrastructure assessment geospatial planning. demonstration, use demo datasets included package. datasets include coordinates public drinking water fountains (blue dots) Naples, Italy (naples_fountains); gridded population raster Global Human Settlement Layer (GHSL) Population Grid (GHS-POP) (naples_population); 100-meter resolution heat hazard map, representing number days Wet-Bulb Globe Temperature 25°C 2008–2017, obtained UrbClim model (naples_hot_days); city’s administrative boundaries (naples_shape).  can use traveltime() function create map current accessibility facility points (represented sf object naples_fountains) within specified geographical boundaries. function allows user select travel mode (walking fastest route) output spatial resolution meters, achieved dissevering spatial downscaling techniques. traveltime() completed, resulting layer can visualized using traveltime_plot() function.  can also generate summary plot compute statistics using output traveltime() function, together demand raster (e.g., population density) specified time threshold, using traveltime_stats function:  can now use allocation() function optimize placement new water fountains, ensuring (virtually) everyone (.e., full extent raster layer specified demand parameter) can reach one within 15 minutes, defined objectiveminutes parameter:  Note also possible solve allocation problem using weights parameter, assigns greater relative importance priority areas demand overlaps weighting factors defined another raster layer, exposure hot days, shown following example:  also possible apply normalization exponentiation different demand weighting layers, enhancing relative influence allocation, using approach, exp_demand, exp_weights parameters (see function documentation details):  variant allocation problem arises set candidate locations new facilities discrete, rather continuous across study area previous example. case, user must provide set candidate points via candidate parameter allocation_discrete() function, along maximum number facilities can selected (n_fac parameter). function applies quasi-optimality heuristic based randomization approach, number replications (n_samples parameter) gradually approaches global optimum, although computational time increases linearly. continuous allocation problem, weight layer normalization exponentiation parameters can also specified.  Now consider scenario user wants choose n_fac facilities meet target objectiveshare total demand, assuming level coverage actually attainable.  Finally, consider case preexisting facilities. discrete location-allocation problem must identify place new facilities cover much demand possible, given limited set spatial options cap many facilities can allocated.
code: library(locationallocation) traveltime_data <-   naples_fountains |>   traveltime(     bb_area = naples_shape,     dowscaling_model_type = "lm",     mode = "walk",     res_output = 100   ) traveltime_data |>   traveltime_plot(     bb_area = naples_shape,     facilities = naples_fountains,     contour_traveltime = 15   ) traveltime_data |>   traveltime_stats(     demand = naples_population,     breaks = c(5, 10, 15, 30),     objectiveminutes = 15   ) #> ℹ 85.45148% of coverage within the 15 minutes threshold. allocation_data <-   naples_population |>   allocation(     bb_area = naples_shape,     facilities = naples_fountains,     traveltime = traveltime_data,     weights = NULL,     objectiveminutes = 15,     objectiveshare = 0.99,     heur = "max",     approach = "norm",     exp_demand = 1,     exp_weights = 1   ) #> ✔ Target coverage share of 99% attained with 28 facilities within the 15 #> minutes threshold. The achieved coverage share is 99.03953%. allocation_data |> allocation_plot(naples_shape) allocation_data <-   naples_population |>   allocation(     bb_area = naples_shape,     facilities = naples_fountains,     traveltime = traveltime_data,     weights = naples_hot_days, # <--- Changed     objectiveminutes = 15,     objectiveshare = 0.99,     heur = "max",     approach = "norm",     exp_demand = 1,     exp_weights = 1   ) #> ✔ Target coverage share of 99% attained with 25 facilities within the 15 #> minutes threshold. The achieved coverage share is 99.16903%. allocation_data |> allocation_plot(naples_shape) allocation_data <-   naples_population |>   allocation(     bb_area = naples_shape,     facilities = naples_fountains,     traveltime = traveltime_data,     weights = naples_hot_days,     objectiveminutes = 15,     objectiveshare = 0.99,     heur = "max",     approach = "norm",     exp_demand = 2, # <--- Changed     exp_weights = 1   ) #> ✔ Target coverage share of 99% attained with 9 facilities within the 15 #> minutes threshold. The achieved coverage share is 99.15597%. allocation_data |> allocation_plot(naples_shape) library(sf)  allocation_data <-   naples_population |>   allocation_discrete(     bb_area = naples_shape,     candidate = naples_shape |> st_sample(20),     facilities = naples_fountains,     n_fac = 5,     n_samples = 100,     traveltime = traveltime_data,     weights = NULL,     objectiveminutes = 15,     objectiveshare = NULL,     approach = "norm",     exp_demand = 1,     exp_weights = 1,     par = FALSE   ) #> ℹ 5 facilities allocated within the 15 minutes threshold. The maximum #> coverage share attained was 88.76062%. allocation_data |> allocation_plot(naples_shape) library(sf)  allocation_data <-   naples_population |>   allocation_discrete(     bb_area = naples_shape,     candidate = naples_shape |> st_sample(20),     facilities = naples_fountains,     n_fac = 5,     n_samples = 100,     traveltime = traveltime_data,     weights = NULL,     objectiveminutes = 15,     objectiveshare = 0.9,     approach = "norm",     exp_demand = 1,     exp_weights = 1,     par = FALSE   ) #> ✔ Target coverage share of 90% attained with 2 facilities within the 15 #> minutes threshold. The achieved coverage share is 90.20134%. allocation_data |> allocation_plot(naples_shape) library(sf)  allocation_data <-   naples_population |>   allocation_discrete(     bb_area = naples_shape,     candidate = naples_shape |> st_sample(20),     facilities = NULL,     n_fac = 5,     n_samples = 100,     traveltime = NULL,     weights = NULL,     objectiveminutes = 15,     objectiveshare = 0.45,     approach = "norm",     exp_demand = 1,     exp_weights = 1,     par = FALSE   ) #> ✔ Target coverage share of 45% attained with 2 facilities within the 15 #> minutes threshold. The achieved coverage share is 46.40227%. allocation_data |> allocation_plot(naples_shape)

title: Compute the maximal coverage location-allocation for continuous problems — allocation
text: demand RasterLayer object demand layer (e.g. population density). bb_area sf boundary box object area interest. facilities sf object existing facilities. traveltime list output traveltime() function. provided, function run traveltime() function based provided parameters. mode (optional) character string indicating mode transport. Options "fastest" "walk" (default = "walk"). "fastest": friction layer accounts multiple modes transport, including walking, cycling, driving, public transport, based Malaria Atlas Project (2019) Global Travel Speed Friction Surface. "walk": friction layer accounts walking speeds based Malaria Atlas Project (2015) Global Walking Friction Surface. dowscaling_model_type (optional) character string indicating type model used spatial downscaling friction layer. Options "lm" (linear model) "rf" (random forest) (default: "lm"). res_output (optional) positive integerish number indicating spatial resolution friction raster (analysis), meters. resolution less 1000, spatial downscaling approach used (default: 100). weights (optional) raster weights demand (default: NULL). objectiveminutes (optional) number indicating target travel time minutes used compute statistics (default: 15). objectiveshare (optional) number indicating proportion demand covered (default: 0.99). heur (optional) heuristic approach used. Options "max" "kd" (default: "max"). approach (optional) approach used allocation. Options "norm" "absweights". "norm", allocation based normalized demand raster multiplied normalized weights raster. "absweights", allocation based normalized demand raster multiplied raw weights raster (default: "norm"). exp_demand (optional) exponent demand raster. Default higher value give less relative weight areas higher demand - respect weights layer. useful cases users want increase allocation areas higher values weights layer (default: 1). exp_weights (optional) exponent weights raster. Default higher value give less relative weight areas higher weights - respect demand layer. useful cases users want increase allocation areas higher values demand layer (default: 1).

what: Compute the maximal coverage location-allocation for discrete problems — allocation_discrete
title: Compute the maximal coverage location-allocation for discrete problems — allocation_discrete
text: allocation_discrete() allocates facilities discrete location problem. uses accumulated cost algorithm identify optimal facility locations based share demand covered, given user-defined set candidate locations maximum number allocable facilities. objectiveshare parameter specified, algorithm identifies best set size n_fac facilities achieve targeted coverage share. problem solved using statistical heuristic approach generates samples candidate locations (top existing locations) selects facilities one minimizes objective function. Options "norm" "absweights". "norm", allocation based normalized demand raster multiplied normalized weights raster. "absweights", allocation based normalized demand raster multiplied raw weights raster (default: "norm"). exp_demand (optional) exponent demand raster. title: locationallocation 0.1.1.9000 (development version)
text: Added cache argument friction() traveltime() functions enable caching friction surfaces improved performance repeated calls. Added file argument friction() traveltime() functions allow loading friction surface disk. Refactored codebase better maintainability. Fixed R-CMD-check issues. Added checkmate defensive programming. Added cli improved command line interface, including progress bars. Added lintr updated code follow tidy tools manifesto, tidyverse design principles, tidyverse style guide. Added spelling spell checking. Added testthat unit testing. Added Contributor Code Conduct v3 incentive contributions. Added CITATION.cff codemeta.json files better citation metadata. Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added R-CMD-check GitHub Action workflow. Added default values allocation(), allocation_discrete() functions. Added demo data documented exports, changed names : naples_shape, naples_population, naples_fountains, naples_hot_days. Added scale north arrow annotations maps using ggspatial R package. default can disabled setting annotation_scale annotation_north_arrow arguments FALSE. Changed theme ggplot2 plots theme_minimal() customizations. Changed allocation_plot() 0 lower limit color scale. Merged allocation_plot() allocation_plot_discrete() single allocation_plot() function. Changed allocation() allocation_discrete() raise error initial coverage greater equal objectiveshare parameter. Changed traveltime_plot() show travel time contours maximum travel time travel time map. Improved code efficiency performance. Improved documentation examples functions. Removed demo_data_load(), longer necessary. Removed fasterize dependency due compatibility issues Linux systems. Updated _pkgdown.yml better pkgdown site generation. Updated package dependencies latest versions. Updated README documentation added badges R-CMD-check, DOI, license, Contributor Code Conduct.
